snippet: You can describe the shade any way you want, but the new taxis set to start picking up passengers next month mostly outside of Manhattan are definitely green.
abstract: Editorial contends that the new green New York City taxis designed for the outer boroughs, while still controversial in the yellow cab industry, will be a welcome sight for millions of New Yorkers seeking transportation outside Manhattan.

snippet: The deal gives Microsoft a 17.6 percent stake in Barnes & Noble’s Nook division and bolsters the bookseller’s efforts to make its digital business the linchpin of its future growth.
abstract: The deal gives Microsoft a 17.6 percent stake in Barnes & Noble’s Nook division and bolsters the bookseller’s efforts to make its digital business the linchpin of its future growth.

headline.main: Microsoft Deal Adds to E-Book Battle
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Deal Adds to Battle Over E-Books

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and JULIE BOSMAN

snippet: At a lunch panel at the Milken Institute Global Conference, having Xi-Qing Gao on stage provided an opportunity to discuss China's growth with the president of the China Investment Corporation, the nation's largest sovereign wealth fund.
abstract: At a lunch panel at the Milken Institute Global Conference, having Xi-Qing Gao on stage provided an opportunity to discuss China's growth with the president of the China Investment Corporation, the nation's largest sovereign wealth fund.

headline.main: Where China Is a Hot Topic, Even at Lunch

snippet: Not a single car service or livery driver interviewed during an informal survey in Queens on Monday expressed an intention to buy one of the 6,000 outer-borough licenses they can apply for starting May 29. Those who were O.K. with the color cited ...
abstract: Not a single car service or livery driver interviewed during an informal survey in Queens on Monday expressed an intention to buy one of the 6,000 outer-borough licenses they can apply for starting May 29. Those who were O.K. with the color cited a range of financial and regulatory concerns.

headline.main: 'Apple Green' Is a Hard Sell With Livery Drivers
headline.print_headline: ‘Apple Green’ a Hard Sell to Livery Drivers

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes one of the founders of Apple gushing about Windows Phone, a physicist explaining why Moore's law will be defunct...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes one of the founders of Apple gushing about Windows Phone, a physicist explaining why Moore's law will be defunct within a decade and a suggestion that Apple make two acquisitions.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Twitter Sonnets, and the End of Moore's Law

snippet: A new survey by law professors at the University of California at Berkeley suggests that most Americans are uneasy with the idea that their phones could divulge behavioral and personal information to merchants.
abstract: A new survey by law professors at the University of California at Berkeley suggests that most Americans are uneasy with the idea that their phones could divulge behavioral and personal information to merchants.

headline.main: The New Pay Phone and What It Knows About You

snippet: What we're reading in The Times and elsewhere, including articles about New York's economic outlook and a legal battle between Indian tribes and a county district attorney.
abstract: What we're reading in The Times and elsewhere, including articles about New York's economic outlook and a legal battle between Indian tribes and a county district attorney.

headline.main: Morning Buzz, April 30: A Fight Over $150 Million in Tips

snippet: Microsoft announced on Monday that it would invest $300 million in the Nook division for a 17.6 percent stake.
abstract: Microsoft announced on Monday that it would invest $300 million in the Nook division for a 17.6 percent stake.

headline.main: Microsoft to Take Stake in Nook Unit of Barnes & Noble

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and JULIE BOSMAN

snippet: May Day has been a day of celebration and protest for workers in countries around the world, but never in the United States, where it has smacked of socialism. The Occupy movement aims to change that.
abstract: May Day has been a day of celebration and protest for workers in countries around the world, but never in the United States, where it has smacked of socialism. The Occupy movement aims to change that.

headline.main: Occupy Wall Street Brings May Day to America
